                    ### Question
                    In which of the following patients would enalapril be the best first line agent for high blood pressure control ?

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Enalapril is an ACE inhibitor that is beneficial for managing hypertension, particularly in diabetic patients due to its renal protective effects. In the case of the 56-year-old diabetic woman, enalapril is the best first-line agent as it helps reduce blood pressure and provides renal protection. Conversely, enalapril is contraindicated in patients with renal artery stenosis (62-year-old man) due to the risk of renal failure, in pregnant women (32-year-old female) due to potential fetal harm, and in patients with hyperkalemia (41-year-old woman) as it can exacerbate potassium levels. Therefore, the best option for enalapril use is the diabetic woman.
